reviews.title: Decieved by rave reviews
reviews.text: Our experience at this B&B was terrible! I will always remember my 30th birthday due to our wretched room! There was NO t.v., radio, etc. Which would have been fine had we known before hand. I would have packed a book or magazine. We searched high and low in the town for a magazine, which they have none! During our stay it was raining w/ hail and very cold. Our bathroom window did not shut all the way-so we had to wear a coat to go to the bathroom and we had to keep the bathroom door shut since we had no heat in our room. After a breakfast that included charred toast, we went to take a shower and there was no hot water! We ended up leaving early so we could go home and take a hot shower. The staff was completly indifferent-even after I broke down in tears when we left. Don't believe the rave reviews on this hotels website! This was the worst B&B I have EVER been to!

We just returned from a wonderful road trip around Southern California and while in Julian, we decided to stay at the Julian Hotel. I read the other reviews and understand why they are so dramatically different, and hope to shed some light for visitors planning a trip to this authentic gold mining town.
reviews.title: A Quaint and Historic place to stay

likes.liked: — The authenticity of the hotel, proximity to town, and the friendliness of the staff.
likes.disliked: — Perhaps rooms with 2-beds but this is impossible without changing the orgiinal structure.

reviews.text: I will detail our experience first. I was a bit let-down when we arrived in town, based on how small the main street was and how few things there seemed to be to do, but this was quickly overcome by the idea that this would be the perfect opportunity to spend time with my traveling partner and enjoy life as it was many years ago, when some of the hotel's first visitors were enjoying the town.
reviews.title: Interesting place for those that don't require modern hotel conveinces
Smelly - Bad Bed & Breakfast!!!
reviews.text: We chose a room upstairs as they are all authentic to the time with the original doors, paneling, etc., still in place. The doors still lock with a skeleton key! The bathrooms have been updated (thankfully) and there is now air conditioning in most or all the rooms which we were told is a new addition. They are quite small but we were given the opportunity to choose from all available rooms and were shown each room by a helpful young lady who said her family has owned the hotel for the last 30-years. I didn't find the staff to be "indifferent" as reported earlier, and to the contrary everyone was very attentive to our needs.

The rooms are small, but authentic to the era, this hotel has remained very much the same since originally constructed which to me is a plus, but to some travelers who prefer plasma screens and jacuzzi tubs on every stay, this won't be a place you will feel comfortable. The lack of electronic emenities in the room actually causes you to do something unheard of this day and age, wander down to the parlor to spend time with your lover or family, or sitting in the lobby chatting with other guests. I found this to be an extremely rewarding experience and certainly more enjoyable than watching HBO all night. I put together a puzzle for the first time since I was a kid! We also sat on the front porch with coffee late at night, watching the cars pass by (maybe 4 vehicles in an hour) and reading magazines. There is an interesting book in the parlour that describes the entire history of the hotel and makes mention of "notable" guests who have stayed there over the last 100-years from politicians to Johnny Cash. It really gives you a sense of the hotel's history and significance.
reviews.title: A step back in time
A great romantic weekend getaway
reviews.text: As for suitability for children, I personally wouldn't have thought this to be a good hotel if traveling with kids, but there were two families there. I assume they booked a second room for the children since there's only one bed per room (that I know of) and few distractions for youngsters. Having said that, I was surprised to see a young boy, maybe 12-ish happily involved with parlor games with his mother and sibling throughout the stay so perhaps it is worth a shot to show your kids how our ancestors used to pass the time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a little biased considering my husband proposed to me here- so I will try to be fair. Upon check-in, I found the hotel to be charming. Let me just throw this out there, Julian is a small town, so if you are looking for a 4 star hotel, this is not it. But it is clean, welcoming and friendly. We found the staff to be competant and inviting, not "dirty" as described below. It is family run and casual, but definately not dirty. The rooms are simple, and as with most B&B style rooms, there are no televisions, which didn't bother us a bit. After all, we are there to travel, not watch TV. The breakfast is hearty, I have had better, but at least filling. As far as convient, it is located right on the main strip!
reviews.title: Great Memories, Old time feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I purchased a gift certificate for the Julian Gold Rush Hotel for my son and daughter-in-law. They used the certificate to make a reservation for the weekend 7/20-7/22. Unfortunately, my father passed away on Thursday afternoon, 7/19. My daughter-in-law called on Thursday evening, just a couple of hours after we left the hospital, to cancel/reschedule their weekend. She was told that they had to forfeit the gift certificate, and the additional money they paid to upgrade, unless someone else rented the room they booked. Ostensibly, because of the short notice, they were unable to rent the room. Although they ultimately agreed to to refund the money my son paid to upgrade, they refused to allow them to use the gift certificate. Therefore, I am out $259.16!
reviews.title: Gift Certificate/Cancellation Polciy

reviews.text: I would think that any establishment that values referrals and repeat customers would have a compassionate bereavement policy that allocates the loss of room rental to goodwill and marketing. None of my family or friends will ever frequent the Julian Gold Rush Hotel.
reviews.title: Stay for Breakfast!
We Loved This Place!
reviews.text: This is by far the best historic hotel I have stayed in. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was quite small but the detail is fabulous. All the charm of history (such as the doors, wallcoverings, ceilings) is preserved without compromising comfort like newer windows, air conditioning and a very nice, updated bathroom. There was no musty smell in the hotel, despite what any previous review may say.

I managed the stay with my 4 year old daughter, who loved the books and puzzles in the lobby. If you have very active children who would not enjoy these activities, this is probably not the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Lovely historic hotel.

likes.liked: — Quiet location and sense of history.
